items.message: River levels have risen overnight as a result of persistent heavy rainfall.  Flooding is possible from the morning of 29 November 2025. Flooding may affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Arrow between Studley and Salford Priors and the River Alne between Bird in Hand and Alcester on the River Alne including farmland and caravan parks. We expect water levels to remain high into Monday morning, 01 December 2025. We are closely monitoring the situation .  Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 16:30PM on 29 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible on 29 November 2025 . 

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. Rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge have begun to rise, 29/11/2025. 

We are closely monitoring the situation & checking flood defences. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 29 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. The weather forecast is improving, and we expect levels to start returning to normal soon. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 14:00pm on Sunday 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: R Sowe & R Sherbourne and Canley Bk & Finham Bk
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

Flooding is possible today, 29 November 2025 . 

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Ashford and Bakewell areas. Rainfall is forecast into Saturday evening, 29 November 2025. River levels at Ashford in the Water Gauge will remain high overnight. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 

This message will be updated by 17:00 on 29 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including tidal River Esk
items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 11:30pm to 3:00am on Saturday 29th into Sunday 30th November 2025 
Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths along the North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including Sandsend and tidal River Esk. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
River levels have started to rise. Flooding is possible. 

Flooding is forecast from this morning, 29 November 2025 . 

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Teme, River Onny and River Corve and their tributaries. Locations that may be affected include Bishops Castle, Church Stretton, Knighton and Ludlow. Predicted peaks:- Leintwardine 1.0 to 1.2m 29/11 PM, Onibury 1.8m to 2.3m 29/11 PM, Corve 2.4m to 2.9m 29/11 PM. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels continue to rise this morning. Flooding is forecast. 

Flooding is possible from this morning, Saturday 29 November 2025 . 

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted peaks:- Llanymynech 3.3m to 3.8m on 29/11/25 PM, Cae Howel 3.8m to 4.3m on 30/11/25 AM 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. Predicted peaks:- Hay on Wye 1.8m to 2.1m on 29/11 PM, Bredwardine 3.6m to 4.0m on 29/11 evening, Belmont 3.7m to 4.1m on 30/11 AM, Old Wye Bridge 3.1m to 3.6m on 30/11 AM, Mordiford 3.3m to 3.8m on 30/11 AM, Ross on Wye 2.5m to 3.0m on 30/11 PM.
